label: 駅
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: A place or stop on an imperial post road, (ekiro) at which post horses (ekiba) or post ferries (ekisen) were to be found. The households in charge of post roads (ekika or ekiko) were granted post rice fields (ekiden) for their support. Key- communications and transportation. [駅路、駅馬、駅船、駅家、駅戸、駅田]
